alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 15 at 1:22AM AKST until February 15 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow and cold wind chills to 55 below. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Snow drifts will form. Very cold wind chills to 55 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East winds of 20 mph gusting to 30 mph will continue through Thursday morning. This will cause blowing and drifting snow with periods of low visibility along with wind chills of 35 to 55 below. The coldest wind chills are near Point Lay. Conditions will improve Thursday afternoon as winds decrease.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
